subject: Investing
title: Country Risk: Political and Economic
description: A quick, practical guide to Country Risk: Political and Economic.

hook.text: Russia was a popular emerging market in 2021. By 2022, Western investors' holdings were frozen and near-worthless.

buildup.text: Country risk encompasses political instability, corruption, capital controls, nationalization, and conflict.

discovery.text: Rating agencies score sovereign risk. Lower-rated countries offer higher yields to compensate for higher danger.

twist.text: Country risk can materialize overnight. No amount of cheap valuation justifies a market where your capital can be seized.

climax.text: Spread exposure across many countries so a single political shock doesn't devastate your portfolio.

punchline.text: Cheap stocks in dangerous countries aren't bargains. They're priced for the risk.

quiz.question: What is an example of country risk?
options: Government capital controls or asset seizure
A bad quarter for tech stocks
